page.title: 03Transport in Halewood.
page.content: Although two main railways pass through Halewood there are no stations as the only station closed in 1952. There have been plans to reopen the station but for the time being these proposals have been shelved. Halewood does, however, have good bus services. There are a total of eleven services calling in the town. Some of these services run at peak hours only but the majority run throughout the day. The destinations of the buses are varied. They travel to Liverpool, Chester, St Helens, Runcorn, Speke, Garston, Kirkby, Crosby and various other local destinations. Many people use the bus services to Hunts Cross to catch the newly opened railway service into Liverpool, Southport and Kirkby.
